SEARCH
Package sttrswing.model

Class Game

Object
Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameModel
public class Game extends Object implements GameModel
The main Game class responsible for holding all relevant classes for the game coordinating player and enemy actions.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Game()
    Construct an instance of Game with a generated list of 64 Quadrants and a current Quadrant chosen to act as the starting Quadrant.

    • getSurroundingQuadrants

      public HashMap<String,String> getSurroundingQuadrants()
      Returns the Quadrants String symbols around the current Quadrant in the Galaxy.

      The return hashmap will always include the following keys: top topLeft topRight right bottomRight bottom bottomLeft left

      Specified by:
      getSurroundingQuadrants in interface GameModel
      Returns:
      a HashMap<String,String> with the surrounding Quadrants symbols linked to the relevant keys.

    • shields

      public void shields(int requestedEnergySpend)
      If there is any energy to spare, will spend as much of the requested amount of energy as it can to bolster the Enterprises shields.
      Specified by:
      shields in interface GameModel
      Parameters:

      Returns a list of all symbols and their positions for the current Quadrant.
      Specified by:

      Type Parameters:

      Returns:

    • turn

      public void turn()
      Progresses the game state forward by one turn. Calls .tick() on the current Quadrant and calls .outOfFocusTick on Quadrants that are not the current quadrant.
      Specified by:
      turn in interface GameModel

    • phasers

      public void phasers(int energy, Quadrant quadrant)
      Handles the Phaser action, takes in how much energy the user has spent to fire phasers. Phaser energy is spread equally (rounding down) amongst the Klingons in a Quadrant.
      Parameters:
      energy - - how much energy they would like to spend on firing phasers.
      quadrant - - the quadrant we want to fire phasers in

    • torpedoes

      public void torpedoes(int course, Quadrant quadrant)
      Takes a given course, we wish to fire a torpedo at. Handles a torpedo being fired: travelling across the current Quadrant sectors until it hits another Entity or the edge of the Quadrant.
      Parameters:
      course - - course/direction we wish to fire the torpedo along in the current Quadrant.
      quadrant - - the Quadrant we wish to fire the torpedo in.

    • getDirectionIndicatorArrow

      public String getDirectionIndicatorArrow(int course)
      Returns a string representation of which direction a given course will go using utf 8 arrows. 1:"→", 2:"↗", 3:"↑", 4:"↖", 5:"←", 6:"↙", 7:"↓", 8:"↘", otherwise: "X"
      Parameters:
      course - - given course value indicating direction
      Returns:
      a string representation of which direction a given course will go using utf 8 arrows.

    • getVectorFrom

      public XyPair getVectorFrom(double course)
      Returns a XyPair int representation of the direction of movement required to meet a given course.
      Parameters:
      course - a double between 1 and 8.9
      Returns:
      a XyPair representation of the direction of movement required.

    • moveWithinQuadrant

      public void moveWithinQuadrant(int course, double distance)
      Move the given Entity within the Quadrant, by the course and distance given or until another Entity or edge of the Quadrant would be hit.
      Specified by:
      moveWithinQuadrant in interface GameModel
      Parameters:
      course - the course/direction we wish the given Entity to move within the given Quadrant
      distance - how many sectors in the Quadrant to attempt to move

    • attemptMoveInQuadrant

      public boolean attemptMoveInQuadrant(Quadrant quadrant, Entity entity, XyPair vector)
      Attempt to move the given Entity in the given Quadrant, adjusting the Entity position by the given XyPair vector.

      If an edge or other Entity is encountered at the proposed new location, the report for the turn is updated and false is returned.

      If the proposed adjustment would be successful the Entity has its position set to the new position and true is returned.

      Parameters:
      quadrant - - Quadrant we wish to attempt to move the given Entity in.
      entity - - Entity we wish to attempt to move within the given Quadrant
      vector - - the adjustment we wish to make ot the Entity's position
      Returns:
      whether the attempted in Quadrant move was successful or not.

    • moveBetweenQuadrants

      public void moveBetweenQuadrants(int course, double distance)
      Moves which Quadrant the Game is handling using the given course, and given number of quadrants to jump (rounded down).
      Specified by:
      moveBetweenQuadrants in interface GameModel
      Parameters:
      course - - the direction of the jump: 1:→, 2:↗, 3:↑, 4:↖, 5:←, 6:↙, 7:↓, 8:↘
      distance - - how many quadrants to jump through (we drop the decimal for when jumping between quadrants)

    • load

      public void load(Enterprise enterprise, Galaxy galaxy)
      Description copied from interface: GameModel
      Takes a newly made Enterprise and Galaxy to use for the game and updates all relevant internal state.
      Specified by:
      load in interface GameModel
      Parameters:
      enterprise - new enterprise state we want the game to use.
      galaxy - new galaxy state we want the game to use.

    • attemptMoveBetweenQuadrants

      public boolean attemptMoveBetweenQuadrants(XyPair vector)
      Will attempt to move using a given vector one quadrant and returns a boolean value indicating if it succeeded or failed.
      Parameters:
      vector - - vector indicating how we wish to adjust the x and y of our position
      Returns:
      if the attempted move between quadrants was successful

    • export

      public String export()
      Export out a stringified representation of the internal state of our Game, specifically exports the Enterprise x,y,energy, shields, and torpedoes, as well as every Quadrants x,y, number of stars, klingons and starbases. Example output structure: [e] x:5 y:5 e:2500 s:500 t:10 | [q] x:0 y:0 s:111 | [q] x:0 y:1 s:002 | [q] x:0 y:2 s:110 | [q] x:0 y:3 s:021 | [q] x:0 y:4 s:022 | [q] x:0 y:5 s:120 | [q] x:0 y:6 s:012 |

      Specified by:
      export in interface GameModel
      Returns:
      a stringified representation of the internal state of our Game.
